title: De Toren 2015 Book 17 XVII Red (Stellenbosch)
description: This huge, dense and firmly structured bottling absolutely begs for time in the cellar to allow the primary characteristics to mellow and greater elegance and nuance to unfold. Currently, it's an absolute bruiser, with boatloads of plush, ripe black berry and plum characteristics that are coupled with seductive notes of campfire, vanilla bean, Thin Mint, woodspice and licorice root. The assertive tannins produce a bold, extremely firm texture that is in equal measure to the superbly rich and concentrated fruit. Secondary notes of pencil shavings, violets, pipe tobacco and char unfold beneath the fruit, and suggest even further evolution and grace to come with time. Drink 2026–2038.

title: Château Cos d'Estournel 2015  Saint-Estèphe
description: While this wine is rich, it has a classical demeanor, with fine tannins that support but never dominate the ripe black fruits. Full of juicy acidity, it offers black currants and some fine, firm tannins at the end. This will take some time to mature, and the wine will not be ready to drink before 2027.

title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2011 Scharzhofberger Beerenauslese #25 Grosse Lage Gold Kap Riesling (Mosel)
description: Sweet tangerine, pineapple and mango pulsate through this piercing, feather-light wine. It's an exhilarating sweet sip accented by savory nuances of musk and white truffles. Expansive yet thrilling and spry, the finish meanders endlessly. Drinks beautifully now but should hold gorgeously for decades to come.
designation: Scharzhofberger Beerenauslese #25 Grosse Lage Gold Kap

title: Robert Weil 2016 Kiedrich Gräfenberg Beerenauslese Riesling (Rheingau)
description: While exceptionally sheer, almost diaphanous in texture, this sprightly, sumptuous Riesling offers penetrating layers of honey, melon and pineapple nuanced by spice, hay and crushed earth. It's a spine tingling, concentrated wine, with an endless, rippling finish. Delightful already but sure to hold for decades to come.

title: Château Ausone 2015 Chapelle d'Ausone  (Saint-Émilion)
description: The second wine of Château Ausone, this is a great bottling in its own right. Powerful tannins merge into equally fine black fruits. The tannins and a complex mix between ripe fruit, acidity and spice go together into an impressive wine for aging. Drink from 2027.

title: Château Angélus 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. Big tannins and powerful fruit go together in this finely perfumed wine. It has a smoky backdrop, with intense fruits and juicy acidity. It is so fruity and juicy now, though the tension behind the fruit suggests that it will mature quickly and then be at its peak for many years.

title: Château Ausone 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 95–97. Barrel Sample. This is such an elegant wine, powerful in dense fruit and complex tannins yet with a sophisticated acidity. It is harmonious, rich in blackberry flavor and a fine, smoky finish. It will age well over many years, although for its sheer pleasure, it could be enjoyed from 2024.

title: Blandy's 1968 Sercial (Madeira)
description: This beautifully golden-colored, oak-aged wine is bone dry, with the intense acidity working with an orange-marmalade character. Together they give a mature wine that is ready to drink.

title: Quinta da Romaneira 2015 Reserva Red (Douro)
description: From a spectacular Douro quinta, this wine is structured with dark tannins and rich with black-currant and berry fruits. The acidity, dry core and firm texture testify to the wine's aging ability. Drink this wine from 2021.

title: Château Pape Clément 2015  Pessac-Léognan
description: Dense and concentrated, this wine is fully structured and also has great fruit. It is dense, showing the ripeness of both tannins and fruit in this vintage. It will power through its development to be a very fine wine from 2025.

title: Domaine de Chevalier 2015  Pessac-Léognan
description: Spice and ripe fruit aromas lead into a wine that has both richness and a crisp, fruity herbal character. Acidity shines through, giving the wine a tangy, mineral edginess. It will be a delicious fruity wine. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Suduiraut 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Very concentrated, this is a great wine with rich intensity and balancing acidity. Honey and lemon flavors with a dry core of botrytis give the wine great balance as well as great potential for aging. Drink from 2025.

title: Château La Mission Haut-Brion 2015  Pessac-Léognan
description: Concentrated and with tight, mineral fruitiness, this wine is potentially ripe and rich, with citrus and orange peel crispness. The wine will be rich, rounded and packed with fruit, but it will take time. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Trotanoy 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. A seriously structured wine, this has firm tannins, dark rich fruit and great concentration. The black plum flavor is a counterpoint to the dry tannins and ample acidity. It obviously has excellent aging potential; drink from 2024.

title: Vieux Château Mazerat 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Density is the keyword for this wine: Its intense tannins and concentration are palpable. There is certainly plenty of acidity and freshness, but its power will see it age impressively.

title: Claude Chevalier 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This wine is rich with a powerful core of tannins is surrounded by dark fruits. The dense texture and tannins give the wine its concentration and longevity. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Beausejour-Duffau-Lagarrosse 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This is a smoky, structured wine that also has plenty of ripe black fruits. It is richly constructed: dense with enough solid tannins and a rich background to give the wine longevity. Drink from 2025.

title: Château Lynch-Bages 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. This dense wine is setting out to be fine and rich. It has power and density along with ripe blackberry flavors. Its concentration and dark tannins suggest a long life ahead. Drink from 2024.

title: Domaine Serene 2014 Mark Bradford Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Sturdy and structured, this wine offers beautiful tones of ripe blackberry and black cherry, with a dark streak of chocolate. It's primed and brightened by snappy acids, and flows gracefully into a pleasingly creamy finish highlighted by smoke and toast.

title: Fritz Haag 2016 Brauneberg Juffer Sonnenuhr Trocken GG Riesling (Mosel)
description: Demure notes of lemon and crushed mineral on the nose contrast an exuberant palate full of pink grapefruit and hibiscus nectar. It's a gorgeously silky, concentrated dry Riesling, with a firm mineral backbone and electric acidity that need time to meld. Hold until 2020 as it's likely to improve well through 2030.

title: Niepoort 2015 Redoma Red (Douro)
description: First produced in 1991, this wine was a pioneer in the new generation of red wines from the Douro. It is firm with tannins and the strong minerality typical of the Douro. It has weight despite its low alcohol and tense fruitiness. Drink this complex wine with great aging potential from 2020.

title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Medici Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: The best bottle in a stellar lineup of the winery's first 2016 releases, this marries old-vine elegance to lush aromatics, with entwined notes of walnuts, raspberries, thyme, rosewater and citrus. It's a long-lasting, beautifully integrated wine, made with grapes from some of the oldest blocks in the vineyard.

title: Château Carbonnieux 2015  Pessac-Léognan
description: This wine has a wonderful citrus character of fresh lemons and limes that meld with the mineral texture. It is crisp while also structured, bright with acidity and zesty in lemon and orange flavors. The aftertaste is herbal, crisp and bright. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Couhins 2015  Pessac-Léognan
description: This is a rich style of white, in keeping with the rich vintage. Its acidity and tight texture are paired off with the apricot and ripe pear fruitiness. Spice from wood aging adds an attractive background. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Hosanna 2015  Pomerol
description: This wine with its dense and dusty tannins has considerable power as well as concentration. The small 10-acre vineyard has produced a wine packed with both tannins and luscious black fruits. Acidity complements all this richness with its own freshness and balance. Drink from 2027.

title: Barone Pizzini 2013 Naturae  (Franciacorta)
description: This dazzling sparkler hits all the right marks. It opens with heady aromas of citrus, bread crust and lemon pastry while the vibrant palate delivers juicy tangerine, Rennet apple and an energizing mineral note alongside an elegant, continuous perlage. Made from 60% Chardonnay and 40% Pinot Nero with no added dosage, it boasts a pristine quality and a pure, crisp finish.

title: Blandy's 1957 Bual (Madeira)
description: Bottled in 2017, this wine aged in old oak for 60 years. It still has all the sweetness you would expect from a Bual Madeira while also having that old wood, almost golden character. Acidity balances the opulent fruit. Drink this wine now.

title: Château Figeac 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Juicy fruit and delicious cassis flavors are sustained by determined tannins on the palate of this bold wine. It is all in balance, the intense acidity and great fruit given extra richness by the structure. It is always going to be a rich wine, with plenty of bright acidity. For this estate, it will not be a wine for long-term aging.

title: Château Ducru Beaucaillou 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. While this is a dense wine packed with tannins, they never threaten to overwhelm the fruit. The blackberry notes and swathes of ripe fruit give the wine its opulent, ripe and generous character. While the wine will certainly age, it is going to be drinkable relatively soon, certainly by 2024.

title: Château Latour 2017 Les Forts de Latour Barrel Sample  (Pauillac)
description: 94–96. Barrel Sample. Well Structured, this is a wine with remarkable tannins and surprisingly rich fruit. It has lovely juicy acidity and black currant flavor. Open, ripe and generous, it is an impressive wine that will age seriously.
designation: Les Forts de Latour Barrel Sample
